पंद्रह साल। ये—मैं यहाँ पूरे पंद्रह साल से हूँ, पता है? और वो बस... बात ये है कि मैंने actually—[हंसते हुए] कितनी बेवकूफी की बात है—मैंने actually उनकी मदद की थी software चुनने में। HR ने मुझसे कहा था, हम्म, different options evaluate करने को पिछले महीने। [बहुत धीरे से] मैंने basically अपनी ही replacement को hire किया। Irony देखो!

[गुस्से में] और उन्होंने मुझे दो हफ्ते दिए हैं। दो हफ्ते कि, क्या, एक computer program को train करूँ? अपना सारा—[आवाज़ कम होना]

[थका हुआ] छोड़ो। शायद मैं, अम्म, शायद वापस पढ़ाई करूँगी या कुछ। Coding सीखूँगी। [सूखी हंसी] जो नहीं हरा सकते उनमें शामिल हो जाओ, है ना?

[shocked] They just—they just told me. Twenty minutes ago. Um, my position is being... "sunset" is what they called it. [bitter] Sunset. Like, that's supposed to make it sound prettier or something? I mean, basically they're replacing me with, uh, with software. AI software. [pause] 

Fifteen years. That's—I've been here fifteen goddamn years, you know? And they're just... [shaky voice] sorry, I'm trying not to—anyway, they said the AI can schedule meetings and, like, manage calendars and draft emails twenty-four seven. No sick days. No, er, no salary. [sarcastic] Perfect employee, right?

The thing is, I actually—[laughing] this is so stupid—I actually helped them pick the software. HR asked me to, hmm, to evaluate different options last month. [very quietly] I basically hired my own replacement. How's that for irony?

[angry] And they gave me two weeks. Two weeks to, what, train a computer program? To hand over all my—[trailing off] 

I don't even know what I'm gonna tell my kids. Mommy got replaced by a chatbot? [sniffle] God, I'm forty-three years old and I have to start over because some algorithm can... [long pause]

[exhausted] Whatever. Maybe I'll, um, maybe I'll go back to school or something. Learn to code. [dry laugh] If you can't beat them, right?
